Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GLS-ALS
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, however quite noisy. If you plan to sleep at all ask for a room in the back at reservation. Rooms are ok, old carpet, bathrooms appear recently renewed, the rest of the hotel would also benefit of a refresh! Has free WiFi and mini-business facility. Do not miss the roof terrace with a nice view of the Eternal City ! Parking in a nearby facility at 30€/day, unrelated to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the Thick”
Reviews.Author: jsob1949
Reviews.Content: A wonderful find in Rome. Centrally located close to the Colisseum and Victor Emmanual plaza. Nice size rooms well appointed and quiet. Beware they have no parking facilities. It cost me 40 euros a night to park near by. I think they saw us coming. Excellent staff and a very good and assorted breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Step into Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SillySignora
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in the heart of ancient Rome, then this is it. Here central means just that - no need for taxis or buses, so more time to spend seeing what you came for. The hotel is very old and although it could do with a bit of TLC in some parts, it has everything a visitor to Rome needs. Standing outside the hotel door, you may decide to turn right. Just a few feet away you have the entrance to Trajan's Markets, down a flight of steps takes you to his column and there you are, looking out at the Vittorio Emmanuel Monument (make your own mind up about that...). Head left and amble past the Forum towards the Colosseum. If you decide to take a left out of the hotel, make for the little archway - within 5 minutes you will have reached the Trevi Fountain and 15 minutes on from there, the Piazza di Spagna. When you've had your fill of culture for the day and the feet are throbbing, grab a bottle of wine you may have bought from one of the local shops and head up to the terrace of the hotel. The views from here are absolutely breathtaking. Comfortable tables and chairs (and a hammock) are laid out and are perfect for seeing the city's rooftops. The 360 degree view allows you to take in the sights - far beyond the Colosseum you can see the Alban hills in the distance, in front the domes of the churches and the biggest of them all St Peter's. Depending on the time of year wait on the terrace for the arrival of the starlings - millions of them making their way to the trees on the Janiculum Hill providing a stunning display of aerobics before they finally swoop down to roost. I have stayed at the Pace Helvezia many times and it has taken me sometime to write this review as I have wanted to keep it to myself. So don't tell anyone......

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tooter1234
Reviews.Content: A 12-15 euro trip in the taxi from the train station,although the first taxi in the rank was asking 25,check price before getting in the cab.The hotel is walking distance to most of the major attractions,the Vatican is in walking distance but I would go on a guided tour(hotel has info and they will book the one you want(most with hotel pick up) I recommend Carrani tour no 3 you see and learn more in a tour,and you miss the long lines for entry,frankly you can just do it yourself but it would be a mistake.the hotel is a bit tired but clean and the staff are great.the breakfast contrary to some posts,it ibetter than most European hotel breakfasts.If you are looking for a hotel that is clean,walking distance to major attractions,has great staff( and an awesome roof top terrace with amazing views)this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Susan D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for hotel. Staff very helpful and efficient. Particularly enjoyed spending time on the roof terrace in the spring sunshine. Would definitely choose this hotel for a return visit. but would request room further from traffic noise1

Reviews.Title: “Location, location , location”
Reviews.Author: Jasmond
Reviews.Content: Just round the corner from Trajan Column and within a few minutes walking from the Via Del Corso and many of the great sights of Rome. Decor is old fashioned and in need of refurbishment. We had no problem with hot water or noise as we were in a room facing away from the busy road and on the 3rd floor. Some members of our group did have problems with the shower with no hot water but it seemed to happen to rooms on the fifth floor only. The room did feel as it had not been clean too thoroughly but on the whole it is acceptable. The beds were not too comfortable. There was a good choice at breakfast and the staff serving were efficient and prompt with the tea/coffee. You pay for what you get and I think that this hotel is good value if you pay less than 110 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: marielco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. Ten minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain in one direction and even less in the other to the Victor Emmanuel memorial. We found the hotel very clean and the room we had was a good size. It was on the 5th floor with a balcony. I have seen reviews on this site saying there is no deviders between the room balconies but there are. Each balcony is seperated by a devider, they may be new. There is a new lift which holds about 4 people (marked for 6 but could not see that many getting in!). The old smaller lift is still there. The breakfast buffet was indoors as the weather was snowy. We found it answered all our needs nut nothing fancy. Cold meat, eggs, cheese, yoghurts, pastries, bread, fruit, toaster etc... the coffee or tea was served, not from a machine. The roof terrace is amazing. In the warmer weather they serve breakfast there but even in the snow it was a wonderful place with a fantastic view over the city. There is no restaurant in the hotel and no bar or cafe when we were staying. The hotel does have free wifi but the hotel computer in the lounge is pay by use. We found the desk clerks friendly and all understood English. Nearest Metro station we could find was a good twenty minute walk away. This is a big drawback if you are not into walking. Clean, basic hotel in a good location but no idea how they have 4 stars without a restaurant! There is a nice little restaurant called Le Lanterne just under the arches about five minutes away (turn left out of hotel). Double glazing on our room so no noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Muy buen servicio, excelente ubicación!!!”
Reviews.Author: igluso
Reviews.Content: Nos hospedamos en agosto de 2011 y la experiencia fue muy buena. El servicio es destacable y la ubicación es estratégica para visistar los atractivos de Roma. Recomendable 100 % si no buscan lujos pero sí servicio eficiente. VOLVERÍAMOS!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: cmccm
Reviews.Content: Great location to explore Rome and reasonable price. Would rate it as a solid three star hotel. Wide range of choice for breakfast (good for Italy standards). Only main negative for my stay was the intermittent hot water - we were on the 5th floor - and after a few days worked out that there was hot water in our room from 8am! So perhaps not a problem if you're sleeping in or in a different room perhaps. There were two elevators with one not working - but it wasn't a problem to wait for the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, medium class hotel”
Reviews.Author: biker1958
Reviews.Content: How can they get 4 stars ? The staff are helpfull indeed, breakfast is ok, coffee bad for Italy... Location is GREAT and they have a lovely terras on the roof with amazing sightseeing over Rome, you can plan your trip from the roof. If tou want a drink, take your bottle of Italian wime and glasses, cheap and nice. The reception clerck is helpfull also, understands French and English. Rooms are small, we were on the top floor, so hardly no street noise. Fine for a long weekend stay anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Corina937
Reviews.Content: Great location (in the historical center of Rome). Very small rooms, a little old smell, old furniture, good breakfast. A very unpleasant experience : while getting our breakfast, a cockroach was climbing on the wall in the restaurant. Staff very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great wee hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: PKnight07
Reviews.Content: Also known as Hotel Pace Elvetia this is a fantastic hotel!! We stayed July 2009. The location is fab, round the corner from the Vittoria Monument, 5 mins from the Coliseum and 10 mins straight road to Trevi fountain. We walked it to and from the hotel to the bus station for arrival and departure and we also walked from hotel to Vatican City one morning. The roof terrace offers some great views of the area. Great price for hotel, great location, comfy, clean - what more can you ask for? We found the best restaurant down the lane 2 mins from the hotel. Had the best pasta of my life in there!!! Have absolutely no complaints whatsoever and if we ever go back to Rome, this is exactly where we'd stay. Great base to explore a wonderful city ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Only the location was the highlight”
Reviews.Author: CoachClassTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not have been better; a 2 minute walk away from the Colosseum. Great views from the roof terrace! However, these points were generally the only good thing about this hotel. The whole decor is outdated and needs refurbishment. The lift fits only 1 person+bag at a time thus making it difficult to get to your luggage from the reception to your fifth floor room, and when other people were waiting to use it behind you! The lift needed replaced; it sounded as if the cable was going to snap and took its time going between floors. The room had paper thin walls; we could hear our neighbours full conversations each morning! The room that we stayed in had a balcony; however, this was more of a danger, as it low railings/no support and the balcony itself wasn't very wide, as it spread around the whole floor of the building. No privacy on the balcony itself. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast; no lunch/dinner facilities in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Tom W
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived I emailed the hotel to let them know that our stay was for a special occasion and asked if we could have a nice view etc. They never replied. On arrival we had the smallest room I've ever seen. The bed was only just bigger than a single and there wasn't room to swing a hamster, not alone a cat. When I turned the light on, the switch fell off onto the floor exposing the bare wires. I asked at reception for a new room and after a bit of grumbling they obliged, the room was better - clean and large but still not worth they money I paid. The hotel is in a worse state of repair than it looks from the photos, it's not the cleanest in the world and the staff weren't the friendliest. I asked for a beer from the bar and you'd have thought I'd asked for Hippopotamus Juice, it was that difficult to find! On the up side - it's in a good part of town, very easy to get anywhere you want to go and the roof terrace is it's saving grace - amazing views of the city. Breakfast was good too. I would have been happy if i'd paid £50-£60 a night but I paid double that thinking I was getting a posher hotel. Overall I was disappointed. One more tip! Don't ask the hotel to arrange a taxi back to the airport. They were going to charge us 45EUROS but if you walk outside to the taxi rank there is a flat fee of 30EUROS.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tenjes
Reviews.Content: After traveling around Italy staying at 3 star hotels for a few weeks, we were excited to end our trip by staying in a 4 star hotel. Unfortunately this hotel did not have 4 star amenities. The room smelled musty from the air conditioner, and the carpet was dirty in a few places. This was disappointing after seeing how beautiful their lobby seemed. To make up for the dirty rooms, the location was perfect and the roof deck was the best way to end our Italy trip. There was a panoramic view of almost the entire city from the roof deck. Unfortunately we probably would not stay here again because the cleaning crew during the day went through our bags and stole some of our chocolate and liquor souvenirs. Our valuables were not stolen, but it was annoying having to go buy more souvenirs at the last minute and the front desk was not concerned about the theft. They told us maybe we miscounted our souvenirs when we bought them, but we had the receipt and we knew it was someone from their staff that stole them. If I do stay there again (because of the fantastic location and roofdeck) I would lock my suitcase with all my belongings each time I left the room.

Reviews.Title: “JUST A TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: LINDA188666
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Pace for 2 night sand upon arrival the receptionist had put in a wrong date so in reality we were expected arriving there 1 month later! Finally we were given a room and entering we could feel an overwhelming heat. We could not open the window as there was an awfull streetrumour. Finally we decided to go for a walk and to switch on the airco on 16°. When coming back 4 hours later the temperature had not changed at all as the airco didn't work at all! The airco and also the room were completely worn out! Incredible how they dare for a 4* hotel to put their guests in a simular room. We were heading 2 sleepless nights and this we couldn't bear. I must admit that I was furious as I am myself a travelagent and I had informed the reception desk manager that I was coming during this period. I went down to the receptiondesk and finally the young receptionist did his best finding another room in another hotel where we could move in the same evening. Conclusion: if you want to stay at Rome than avoid staying at the Pace Helvetia Best regards Linda

Reviews.Title: “Great location - remarkably bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: CambodiaGina
Reviews.Content: The good first - fantastic location, couldn't ask for better. Awesome rooftop with spectacular views - it was fine to take your own bottle of wine up there and take it all in. Breakfast was no frills, but acceptable. The rest....my mum and i stayed for five nights in the middle of a very hot summer. Our room was tiny as it was lodged in behind the elevators - so we had the pleasure of listening to the elevators going all night. Worst of all was the heat - our airconditioner did not work - it just blew out room temperature air....after reporting this repeatedly to reception for two days, we gave up and just asked that a fan be provided in the room. The receptionist told us each morning the same thing - that there was no chance to change rooms, he was sorry that the aircon didn't work, and that he would organize a fan. One never materialized. On the last night, the electricity went out across the whole hotel, and we had to lay damp towels across the pillow to keep cool - as my mum is in her seventies, none of this was acceptable. This would be what i expect from a guesthouse in a developing country, not a hotel in a developed one. The tiny room (we had to squeeze sideways past the foot of the bed to get to the other side of the room), miniscule bathroom, noise from the street and elevator - i can tolerate all this easily, but not the absence of an airconditioner AND fan in the midst of summer, despite repeated requests for either relegates this to one of the worst hotels i've ever stayed at. It was a good lesson though - don't pay everything up front when you book online!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nikoleta05
Reviews.Content: The only good about thiw hotel is teh location. In the herat of Rome,just a few minutes walking from the most important monuments. The hotel does not deserve its 4 stars. Its a 2 star hotel...The furniture and the carpet are from Nero's era. The room had a disgusting smell of dirty due to the old and filthy carpet. When we first got into,we found a pair of socks from the previous guest and when my husband throw by mistake a ciagerete behind the bed,they didnt took it until the time we left the room.... The bathroom was quite good,bad there was mould on the top...and I saw some ants and two other insects in it. The hot water took a long time to come also,and there wasn't a regular douche with cable but there was one douche on the ceiling which made it too dificult for a woman to be washed... The most exasparating from all about this hotel,is that although we stayed there 5 nights,they didnt changed sheets at all!!! This is unbelievable for a 4 stars hotel. Another very annoynig thing is that it hasn't pugging at all. As it is in a very central road,the noise from the cars was very annoying... The breakfast was the only good surprise in this hotel. It was a very rich bufet... I think it did't deserve the 105 euros we payed per night and there are better hotels in Rome to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull weekend at Pace Helvezia”
Reviews.Author: Belledonna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at hotel Pace Helvezia. We definately gives it 5 stars. We stayed in a lovely and quiert room on the 5.th. floor with a huge balcony and great view. Receptionstaff very polite and helpful. Hotel very clean and located just in the middle of everything. Of course there are traffic outside the hotel - come on your are in the middle of a rather big city - what do you expect.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base Camp - no Luxery”
Reviews.Author: LisbonRudi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location – Great – I saw so many times the Fontana di Trevi… (every day) - Colisium – 15 mints walking Breakfast – simple, not so many choices there. Elevators - Can they make it even smaller??? Room – Between 2 elevatior’s on the 5th floor – no noise , due to winter time, the room smell like mold. Simple and basic – no more no less. Reception – normal Bar – I saw one… was it working Tips – restaurant – when you leave the hotel turn left , and left again, and on your way down, there is a good value for money restaurant- before the Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan194727
Reviews.Content: This was the last of 4 star hotels that we stayed in in Italy. There were 10 other family members with us. Everyone had a problem, ourselves included, with their rooms.This ranged from no air conditioning to cold water in showers, noise from traffic, as well as cleanliness of the hotel in general. We had to keep turning off our shower so that it wouldn't overflow.The breakfast buffet was very limited and your juice and coffee came out of a machine. There was no waitstaff to clear your dish. The bar opened at 5 and was closed by 9. No bellman available and the elevator was so small we had to take turns bringing our luggage up and down. The rooftop deck was small but the views were beautiful . The location was convenient. Other than that there was nothing good to say.This is more like 1-2 star hotel if you are used to staying in 4 star hotels in Italy. It is too bad because this could be a lovely place to stay with a great location and fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: JoanneOS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very centrally located and I would stay here again if going to Rome. Breakfast was included in our rate and was good. The room was fine, basic like alot of Rome hotels. The location was the best thing about this hotel and meant you could walk almost everywhere. The staff were very helpful at reception and even recommended some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4*, not even 3...”
Reviews.Author: AndyL18
Reviews.Content: As part of our holiday touring Italy this summer, Citalia arranged this hotel as part of a "tailor made" trip visiting Venice, Florence, Rome and finishing in Lake Como. The only stipulations we gave were hotels should be 4* and close to the attractions in the cities. Compared to the others, this was nowhere near the quality, and I struggle to see how it justifies it's star rating. When we walked in the door, we knew we were in trouble.... no staff, small one-man reception, faded decor, no bell-hop for the luggage, no restaurant - but it was in a nice location, or so we thought. Receptionist explained that we could not have a room higher than 2nd floor, as Citalia wouldn't allow UK guests higher (to do with safety laws and fire escapes I think - read into that what you may!). When we reached our rooms, the air-con didn't cool below 20deg C (while our children's room went to 16deg) and the staff said that was how it should work! - no attempt to come and fix or even see the problem - the room was in poor repair (telephone socket dangling from a cable and not fixed to the wall), not properly cleaned, and above all excessively noisy (right on main road with traffic thundering by, and all through the night apparently). We asked to change rooms, and were offered another that was little better, but smelt of mildew. To their credit, Citalia changed us without cost to another in the same group, the Eliseo, immediately. We lasted one night there, not the three we'd booked for, as at 1230 am, the aircon sprung a leak right outside our door. The sole staff present (4*?) decided that he could only put a (leaking!!!!) bucket under the constant drip.... when asked whether we could change rooms, the answer was no, none available. When asked why he didn't call a maintenance man out on emergency cover, he explained that he was the only person on site, and had no emergency number to call for assistance - they were all asleep (unlike us....). Apparently the hotel chain has 17 hotels in Rome, but doesn't feel that they need to serve their guests properly by investing in sufficient staff. I empathise with the other posts that state that the hotels we have seen here are not 4* - they may once have been, but it felt to me that this is a chain of hotels that should be avoided at all costs. I would never go back. Admittedly, it may have been a one-off experience, so read through the posts (for Eliseo too) and see whether you want to take the chance... My comment to Citalia is that they should send a mystery guest to stay, and then decide if they want to still feature this as a 4* hotel. When compared to their other city picks (Bonvecciati in Venice, and Grand Hotel Baglioni in Florence), this is at least 2 grades below...

Reviews.Title: “central location, but not a 4*hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarolineEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed there beginning of June and were disappointed. This is not a 4 star hotel! A 3 star maybe. The hotel is in great need of refurbishment. It is on a very busy main road. Why is it a 4star? Is it the spacious lounge you never use, the two small lifts and addtional WC on the lower ground floor? Otherwise the room was basic. Cleanliness was hit and miss with dust on top of warddobes, curtains and along plynths. Breakfast was not briliant, food was not kept chilled properly. Rome is so small that in fact any hotel will be fairly centrally located, so you are always next to your favourite sites. On the plus side the reception desk was friendly. The terrasse has fabulous views across the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Susysed
Reviews.Content: The above title says it all really. This hotel is situated on a very busy road and of course there is a lot of traffic noise from early morning to late in the night ( italian drivers are mad!) but the hotel has good sound proofing so we were able to sleep well. But this can be overlooked when you consider to location of this hotel, you can walk just about everywhere, all Romes main attractions are in a small area and the small back streets are a joy, you never know when you are going to come across another BEAUTIFUL church. Bars and restaurants galore (TIP eating and drinking on the main tourist piazzas is V expensive - go a couple of streets back and eat like the Romans do - fantastic). The hotel itself is fine - not luxury but who is going to spend a great deal of time indoors in Rome?? the rooms may be small compared to some, but all was clean and the breakfast was good, (only gripe was machine coffee - yuk). As said before the roof terrace is fantastic and gives you a sense of Rome in all its glory! Watch out for the beggars, like most big cities Rome has its fair share, my husband came close to losing his wallet - a group of 3-4 women surrounded him, tried to hold onto his arms whilst one went into (almost) his pockets - BE WARNED, they seem to target men because obviously most won't fight back! Scary but we did'nt carry large amounts of cash around. We had a wonderful few days in Rome and we tossed our coins into Trevi fountain so will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: WeLikeToTravelToo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pace Helvezia Via IV Novembre 104 Rome, Italy From: cherylsteve | May 12, 2010 | 41 views Loading...Pace Helvezia is a nice hotel located within walking distance of Rome's historic sights. For example: 5 minutes to the Trevi Fountain, 15 min. Spanish Steps, 15 min. Pantheon, 20 min. Coliseum, and about 30 min. to the Vatican. Our 4 day stay was very enjoyable and I would not hesitate to stay here again. Room #94 for 4 days Sept. 10-14 2009 @ $164 EUR per day $656 EUR total, but we booked through Venere and received a 4% discount at check out. I loved every minute of our stay and must say the staff was friendly and professional in every way. Breakfast included various meats, cheeses, breads, cereals, eggs (hard boiled) yogurts, fresh fruit, pastries, juices and of course espresso and cappuccino etc. The roof top terrace is not to be missed. Our room had a small balcony with lime trees all around which was nice. We also rented a scooter and rode to Lido di Ostica for a fun day at the beach. Motorcycling in Rome is not for the faint of heart and suggest only experienced riders consider this option. CHECK-IN DATE: 10 September 2009 CHECK-OUT DATE: 14 September 2009 NUMBER OF NIGHTS: 4 ROOMS BOOKED: 1 Double B&B Daily total 10/09/2009 164.00 EUR 164.00 EUR 11/09/2009 164.00 EUR 164.00 EUR 12/09/2009 164.00 EUR 164.00 EUR 13/09/2009 164.00 EUR 164.00 EUR Total price : 656.00 EUR TOTAL PRICE: 656.00 EUR 4% discount offered by Venere.com : -26.24 EUR Total amount to be paid at the hotel: 629.76 EUR ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Contact Information of the Hotel Pace-Helvezia ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Hotel Pace-Helvezia ADDRESS: Via IV Novembre 104 CITY: Roma [-] For a great Vatican tour ( don't go with out one) try "MyVaticanTour" company cost for 2 people was euro 104.00. The rest of the landmarks around Rome can be enjoyed and understood independantly with out the need of a guide. We are both in our 40's in average condition and walked somedays up to 8 miles total with out any problems. There is so much to see and do the walking and days just fly by.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Clean”
Reviews.Author: scotslizzy
Reviews.Content: Although this Hotel is rated 4 stars I do not think this is deserved. The room we were given did not look like the one in the advertisement . It was clean and functional nothing more. Furniture was shabby but it was clean. The main issue for us was the noise level . Although I had read about this I did not think it would be as bad .A hard lesson learned and the first night the air con was not working so we had to sleep with the window open so you can imagine the nose level. The location was good and the breakfast what you expect for Rome. Whether I would stay there again I dont think so there are so many hotels to choose from in Rome there must be some that dont have the same issues with noise .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in the centre of Rome - not too many frills but recommended”
Reviews.Author: Clibil
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviewers, I think that much of their disappointment comes from the fact that this is a typical Italian city hotel - comfortable and uncomplicated but the rooms are small and quite simple. We stayed on business through the chaos of the volcano crisis and saw the staff at first hand helping out stranded passengers and posting airline notices. The staff are friendly and helpful and definitely do their best. The hotel has good double-glazing but if the windows are open it is noisy - but, hey, it's 250m from the Trevi Fountain with great restaurants close at hand so what do you expect ? Room standard is clean (with a domestic refrigerator for minibar so you can keep your own water bottles in there - nearby minimart sells 1.5l for 22 cents) and the TV has CNN. The electric points look a bit medieval but work OK. The bed was very comfortable and is changed every day by the lovely, friendly chambermaids. I could not see any tea-making facilities. Breakfast is good every day with warm pastries, cheese, meat, yoghurts, cereals etc and is a bit more sumptuous at weekends. Orange juice is a concentrate remix so not great. Coffee is fine. Wifi is €10 for 6 hours on your own PC - dearer on theirs but speed is OK The jewel in the crown of this hotel is its roof garden. The views are superb and it is very quiet, and the wifi reaches it, making it possible to work up there while drinking in the views. Several people have commented about the lifts, they are small but well-maintained and hold only 3 people plus a few bags. Perfectly adequate but not Las Vegas. We intend to go back there next year for another stay - WITHOUT the volcano !

Reviews.Title: “Be on your guard”
Reviews.Author: tituspullo75
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 22 university students and also my wife and two adult daughters. We had intended to stay on a third night after the students had left, but an unavoidable circumstance forced a change of plans. I notified the hotel on arrival, i. e., over 48 hours in advance, and was told there would be no problem. However, they subsequently refused to refund the 220 euros for the third night, despite their promise to do so, and will not even give me the courtesy of replying to my messages requesting clarification ofr their actions. Incidentally, on checking in we discovered that some of the rooms were dirty (nail clippings on the carpet, etc., etc.).

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: 30sEuroCouple
Reviews.Content: The Pace Helvezia Hotel is supposedly a four star hotel, that as others have written, is located relatively close to the many beautiful sights of Rome. That is the ONLY positive aspect of this truly terrible hotel. It is the worst hotel experience i have ever had - and being a banker from London I travel quite a bit (and not only to typically posh hotels & places). What to expect if staying at the Pace: * As our prebooked taxi, organized by the hotel, did not show up at the airport we called the prebooked taxi to let him know and then took a regular taxi from airport to the hotel. We paid EUR 40, and would otherwise have paid EUR 50 with the hotel taxi (...). The incredibly RUDE receptionist ( ) then told us that we had to pay the EUR 50 for the prebooked taxi as his friend, the taxidriver, had indeed been at the airport. When I told him that I had actually called him and spoken with him, the receptionist said I was LYING. As i showed him my mobile phone with the dialed number he still didnt believe that i had actually called and spoken with the taxidriver - as i could simply have called up and hung up.. USE a normal taxi from airport for EUR 40! More about the subsequently grumpy receptionists later. * After such check-in we got took the SCARY small and run-down lifts up to our room. It was small, stuffy, with two separate beds (we requested one), with a non-functioning shower and a lounge chair that fell appart when sitting in it. It was also unbearably LOUD so impossible to sleep at night as we were not able to move room the first night. * The breakfast is ok as long as you like DRY bread and pastries, old milk, ready-made machine coffee and a factory-like ambiance amongst other equally UPSET hotel guests. * The hotel is in a really BAD condition, the paint is falling from the walls, the carpets are stained & furniture (or lack of) in main areas are really poor. A shame as the building itself has some potential, a roof that could be used for nice terrace and a decent location. * After a few days sightseeing the beautiful Rome, we came again to check out for ourselves and our parents room. BEWARE, In truly DODGY style, another receptionist then tried yet again to RIP US OFF by overcharging us by EUR 450. He simply would not accept that 350+450 was not equal to 1250 EUR...and it took us some 10 minutes of arguing before he simply accepted our "low" payment, never apologizing for having made an error. Don't let a bad hotel experience detract from your visit to the great city of Rome, DO NOT STAY AT THE PACE!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for seeing rome”
Reviews.Author: 1DonIreland
Reviews.Content: Pros: Perfect location for seeing the sights, Coleseum and forum only a short distance from Hotel, Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps only minutes away. Roof top garden is wonderful and gives an incredible view of the city. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Plenty of restaurants close by. Cons: Room was a little smaller than I'd hoped but to be fair it is to be expected as it is a very central location. When we first stayed there we got a very good deal on the cost of the room and as we plan to return this hotel was our first choice but the room prices have risen considerably since then. But thats inflation for you. Hotel is located on a busy street but our room was to the rear so noise wasn't really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesItalia
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at hotel Pace Helvezia. We found the rooms to be spacious (given Italian standards) and clean (some rooms are much smaller as we experienced on our last stay). The bathrooms were roomy and the shower large enough to accomidate my 6 2', 240 LB husband. The location is noisy as it is on a main road through Rome, so keeping the windows close is necessary for a quiet nite sleep. Some small issues were the blow dryer worked but was taped together, the shower drain did not seem to flow fast enough to keep up with the water flow. We had to stop the shower occasionally to allow the water to drain and the pillows were very hard. We enjoyed the rooftop terrace while having our evening coffee and relaxing before our flight out the next day. WI-FI was available for a fee at this hotel which was a bit annoying. We stayed at other hotels in our travels to Italy were the service was free and there are many other hotels in Rome where this service is free as well. I personally feel WI-FI service should be free for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with an incredible roof terrace"”
Reviews.Author: stfa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights (week 38 of September), and had booked a single room. However, I got a double room without any extra cost. The room (number 44) was spacious, equipped with air-conditioning, and the bed sheets got changed every day. Not that it matters a great deal, but the TV channels were really poor – 4 channels to choose from. But hey, who travels to Rome to watch TV, right? The breakfast was reasonable with no complaints. I have been to Italy about 100+ times so I know breakfast in Italy isn´t something they are very good at, but it´s reasonable. The main reason for choosing Pace Helvezia is the great location, which is close to everything within walking distance. 5 minutes stroll to Trevi Fountain, and 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps. The roof top terrace is absolutely breathtaking and nearly empty all the time. 360 degrees view and one of the highest roof tops in the area. And excellent place to finish off a long days walk with a cold bottle of Prosecco, and watch the skyline in Rome. Unfortunately, the bar was closed as it would have been nice to order something. September is high-season in Rome and therefore the bar should have been open for the guests. Yes, the two elevators might be small, which only fit 3 people. But they do have two elevators and not just one. One should note that every single hotel in Rome is NOT to be compared with, say, hotels in Florida, California or even Scandinavia. Hotels in Rome are smaller due to the age of the city so it´s unjustifiable to complain about room size, facilities and super luxury. Hotel Helvezia is rated as a four star hotel, and judging by the hotel standard in Rome Hotel Helvezia is worth of its four stars – especially taking the room price into account (Euro 111.50 per night), as well as the location, and the outstanding roof top. As Rome is an extremely busy city traffic wise there are noise coming into to the rooms adjacent to Via V Novembre. I´m sure more modern sound proof windows could solve this problem in the future. However, I didn´t encounter any significant issues with the noise as I live in a busy city already. All in all, this is a great hotel I can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: MAKEM2
Reviews.Content: Just had a three night stay in rome. Stayed at the Pace Helvezia. The hotel is in a great location. The colosseum is literally just down the road (half a mile away). The other sights are within walking distance. From the rooftop terrace the view is brilliant. We had a twin room, While not large it was big enough for two people & their junk! & had air conditioning, a must in rome in August!, everything worked ok, the room was clean & very comfortable. Maid service every day. Breakfast was a buffet with lots to eat. The hotel is just like the pictures on their website. If I was going back to rome I would definitely stay at this hotel. Rome is a great place to visit but very expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for seeing a truly remarlable city”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Mayers
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my wife for my 50th birthday, a place I had always wanted to visit and wasn't dissappointed one bit! The Hotel is located pretty central, from the roof top terrace, which was nearly always deserted, you can see the Colloseum and St Peters and just about every major tourist site in between! I would recommend a taking a nice bottle of wine up to the terrace at the end of a hard days sight seeing and just relaxing as the city goes about its business in the streets below, a nice escape from the inevitable hordse of tourists that can make some parts of the city feel a little claustrophobic. The staff are polite and helpful, even to the point of bringing drinks up to the terrace from reception if asked. The rooms are a little on the small side, but this is a city centre hotel, but very clean and well fitted, we even had English TV channels! The nearst attraction is the Trevi fountain, about 5 minutes stroll, which seems to be packed at any time of the day or night, go there at night though for the atmosphere, its rather surreal! The Colloseum is about 15 minutes walk and St Peters about 30 minutes, but on the way to St Peters you can visit the Pantheon and Piazza Nevona as they are both enroute. The restaurants around the tourist areas are, as expected a little on the pricey side, but walk a couple of streets back and you will find some gems with very reasonable prices and better food, worth looking around for as you can save up to 50%! On the whole I would go back to both this hotel and Rome any time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jettafan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pace Helvezia Hotel for 3 nights. We had a double room (two twin beds combined) on the 3rd floor. They met our request for a room not facing the street. Due to this we did not have any noise issues. Overall the room was basic but clean. The shower stall in the bathroom was rather small (even for European standards). The hotel location was convenient and had a bus stop within one block. The hotel was within a reasonable walking distance to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Most staff members were very friendly and more than willing to help. The breakfast consisted of meats, pastries, cereal and fruit, etc. Pricey in my opinion but worth it if you value being closer to some of the more popular sites. WiFi was available for a fee, but there was a computer in the lobby. We booked the room through Venere.com and saved 4% by using code 9MCETU3. You can use the code for multiple reservations by using a different e-mail address.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MikeN_GR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was suited in the center as described. We stayed for 3 night in a triple room. The room was enormous, nothing very special or luxury but it was clean and dissent. The hotel staff was very helpful for every information we asked. Breakfast was good with plenty of food to enjoy. Location is very good - near Colosseum and all the maigor sites. If you are looking for a convenient Hotel in the center and don't have any huge expectations I would definitely suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Rome, the Indy 500 of Italy”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyLane
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome at the end of our trip to Italy. We had been to Florence, Venice, Cinque Terre, Pisa, Siena, San Giamgianno, and other smaller towns. So, Rome was literally like the Indy 500 of Italy. Wide streets, numerous cars zipping down the roads, lots of noise and action. The hotel was located in a great spot to walk to all the major attractions: Colosseum, Forum, Pantheon, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Victor Emmanual monument (great view of Rome from the top, after taking the secret elevator), and numerous museums and sights. The Vatican is a much longer walk from here, but an easy bus ride, which the hotel staff helped us with. The first room we were in was too loud, so they moved us to their 'random room off the lobby' which had no number on the door, but it was quiet. It had no view, but who's in the hotel when in Rome anyhow? The breakfast was great. The staff was very helpful. The hotel was big but still charming. Remember, this is in the center of Rome and is old. So, embrace the Italian culture and older hotel. But, as it was old, it wasn't crummy old, but nice old. Small elevators, wide staircase. Some nice restaurants in area. Ask the staff for ideas. If you want to eat alot, go left out of the hotel door, left at corner, cross halfway down the block and find the restaurant that seems to serve all the big groups. Lots of food, good value. For more charming, family trattoria, take a right out the door, go about halfway down the block, turn right and go halfway down the big staircase to restaurant on the right. That is also the shortcut to the colosseum. Ask the staff. They are very helpful. We had them hire us a driver to take us to Pompeii, it was cheaper than the train. It was quite an experience driving on the autostrada and thru the backroads of Rome, with a real Italian driver...it was like being in the middle of the 'Italian Job' movie! Fun trip. Nice hotel. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location with a Fantastic Roof Terrace”
Reviews.Author: GingerTravellingScot
Reviews.Content: Slightly out of date as we stayed in this holiday during October 2007 whilst we were in Rome for four and a half days. We had a standard double room on one of the upper floors (a must as all the streets in Rome are cobbled which makes the traffic noisey). The room was relatively compact but typical for Rome with a standard double bed, dressing table and a small fitted wardrobe. The bathroom had a bath/shower, sink and WC all of which were modern and clean. We had breakfast at the hotel each day which provided a good mixture of cold food. The greatest positive about this hotel is the rooftop terrace where you can bring a bottle of wine, write your postcards and watch the sunset. The hotel is also very centrally located and as Rome is best explored on foot we didn't use public transport expect getting to and from the airport. If we were to go back to Rome I would stay at this hotel again but only if we could get a room on one of the upper floors again. Ps the lifts were very slow but only a small problem

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: croftonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pace Venezia for 4 nights. We are a mature couple who like to explore on foot, getting the real flavour of a city, its people and culture so we tend to research the location where we wish to stay thoroughly. We describe ourselves as backpackers at heart who have matured to enjoy reasonably comfortable accommodation. We chose Pace Venezia because it is conveniently located in the old city (Colosseum, Forum, Campodoglio, Vittorio Emanuelle monument etc) within easy walking distance of reasonable quality, low cost restaurants (if there is such a thing in Rome) and a short walk to Fontana de Trevi, Spanish Steps and open top bus routes. The hotel staff were always helpful and we enjoyed the rooftop terrace and breakfast in the breakfast room. We always request a quiet room and they obliged (the front is noisy as the road is very busy). The room was comfortable, bathroom was clean, a fridge in the room and air conditioned. The room was serviced daily and whilst our chosen price range does not provide 5 star sparkle, the hotel was clean and comfortable with a good shower. We will return to Pace Venezia without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Dollardoll1
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for my 21st birthday in July and had the most fantastic experience! The room was a pleasant suprise after some of the reviews we had read and we were very happy. It was clean and to a very high standard, with air conditioning that was very much appreciated. I must say that the rooms were noisy through the night but being in the centre of a city this really should be expected. Breakfast was also fantastic, we looked forward to it every morning and were never let down! I must say though beside the fab location the best selling point of the hotel is the roof terrace...amazing! It also turned out to be the spot where i got engaged! We had an amazing week in Rome and the hotel very much added to this experience..brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, marvellous roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: ThomasFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 5 nights. We wanted a hotel nearby the old center of Rome. We stayed in room 84 on the front side of the hotel on the fifth floor. We had a spacious room with 4 beds, a big bathroom and a fantastic airco (>38 °C outside). We had a little terrace (for which it was too hot to use). Breakfast was more than OK. Service was very good. Housekeeping was more than OK. Roof terrace view is worth a million !!! Some minor points : On Saturday the hotel seemed completely full and the available staff (we called him "Antonio" :-)) could not manage the pressure. The other waitress (who was back on Sunday) could do it easely. The same day housekeeping forgot to clean our room. Reception called someone to do it in the evening ... an Italian man came up with clean sheets and towels but did not know where to start (Italian men probably are not allowed to do something in the household :-)). When I requested a Espresso in the evening they told me that the bar was not available in the summer season ... a pitty ... we could have enjoyed the coffee on the roof. As you are not allowed to drive in the city during the day we parked our car in the ParkSi parking at the Villa Borghese. The last nigth we left it on the street ... Rome is a very safe city. We've peeked in other rooms and they looked less spacious and had a terrible view. So if you stay ... ask for a room on the sixth floor or a room on the front side of the building on the fifth floor. The corner rooms (eg. 84) are the largest. Our room and our stay are absolutely worth 3 or 4 stars. The view from the roof terrace upgrades it to at least "****". We reccommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: OsloViking
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and nice building, but the rest of our experience did not earn the hotel 4-stars. The hotel is generally run down, the street is noisy. Breakfast was OK, but not adquate to justify 4 stars. Front desk service was not helpful, generally the reception neglected requests and complaints. Bed/matrass quality was clearly sub-standard and bathrooms very run down and not clean. Noise from the corridor. We were totally surprised that this hotel had 4 stars, it should 2 stars, not more than 3.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down!”
Reviews.Author: dawks6
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay in this dreadful hotel. We should have read the reviews on Trip Advisor before booking! This is said to be a 4 star hotel - HOW? There is nowhere in the hotel to get a hot drink, no bar, a cold breakfast which is not particularly appertising, the lifts are so small they profess to take 3 or maybe 4 (different signs on each side of the lift!) At one point we took the lift to our third floor room (6 flights of stairs) and it got stuck with only two average size people in it. Luckily I managed to prize the door open as nobody answered the alarm bell and my wife was beginning to panic. The lifts were not used again after this incident on the second day. You had to pay for a safety deposit box per day - this is not what you expect for a four sstar hotel. How do they do their ratings? To say it was noisy is understated. The room was at the back of the hotel (dull and dingy) and the a/c did not work and in order to get some air into the room we opened the window. Eventually we had to shut this as a road sweeper seemed to take forever cleaning a small car park at the rear of the hotel (with cars) at ridiculouse times of the night 2.00 a.m., 3.00 a.m. 4.00 a.m. The only saving grace for this hotel is the ideal location. We walked to all the main attractions, colliseum, pantheon, trevi fountation and spanish steps but had to catch the bus to the vacitcan city as we were not sure of the route. Again, if it had not rained you could have walked although this would have taken about 20-30 minutes. Don't let this put you off visiting Rome. A beautiful place and well worth a visit. It is expensive but then nowadays what isn't, please think before you stay at this hotel. We did find another hotel just round the corner and which we will use when we return. The Cosmopolitan Hotel which has a bar and restaurant attached so hot drinks and meals, we even managed to look at the rooms and WOW they were superb as you would expect for a 4 star hotel or even better.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop view is worth a million!”
Reviews.Author: Nanam
Reviews.Content: Our final night in Rome was spent at this OLD hotel. We had been told this was a 4star hotel, with air conditioning! Ha! This was maybe a 3star with no a/c! When we arrived in our room, the window was open / shutters closed / allowing the 90+ heat to permeate the room. We quickly found the remote to turn on the a/c (ask at the desk if you don't have one!) and closed the window. It took several hours to cool the room to a bearable temperature. Very noisy location -- heard the sirens of the ambulances all night long, and we had a rear room. Nice location for walking to the Rome historic sites, but very noisy. The "king" room was actually two well-worn mattresses shoved together ..... my side sloped to the middle dramatically! There was a picture of the Blessed Mother above the bed ... not real romantic! The bathroom layout was so crazy -- the bidet and toilet were nearly atop one another, blocking access to the sink or shower. The shower floor filled with water quickly. I just happened to realize the water was around my ankles, quickly found the drain, and pulled the drain out so water could drain. Two other companions said the same thing happened in their shower -- beware! Breakfast room was nice, but small. We found the same cheeses, breads, cereals, meats, fruit as in other hotels. The waitress was VERY friendly and attentive -- a plus. The best part of this hotel was the rooftop view. We purchased a few bottles of wine and took them to the rooftop for our farewell party. A small group of travelers joined us as we watched the sun set on the city..... beautiful. This certainly canceled the negatives of the hotel..... I would return for the view, period. A dining hint: Ask for directions to the Sicilian restaurant up the street, down the steps. Great food / friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* as we are used to”
Reviews.Author: PATRAVELEREngland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from staying at the Hotel Pace Helvezia. Very good location clean but that is all. Very noisy, had a room on the sixth floor (Like an attic room) the window was about 6ft above ground level so you could not see out of it. Room was very hot had air con on full but did not make much difference, very depressing room. Breakfast very poor, some mornings you could have finished breakfast before the coffee arrived. Spoilt our trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scrimletsdad
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights at this hotel. It was our first trip to Rome and we were delighted with the hotel, its location and especially its roof top garden. The first night we had the garden to ourselves and marvelled at the views of the city as the sun set. The hotel itself is a little rough round the edges but this just added to its charm. Breakfast was excellent and when requested was served in our room for just €3. There was some noise from traffic outside, but no more than I would expect in any major city, and it certainly didn't affect our sleep or enjoyment of the hotel. The room was spacious with plenty of room for our 2 year old daughter to play while we got ready to go out. I have already recommended this hotel to several friends and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterTyneside
Reviews.Content: We returned from this hotel on 23/5/07 after 3 night stay. This is definitely NOT a 4star hotel. We have been to Rome 4 times and have stayed in a far more impressive 3star hotels. The hotel is located in a brilliant position close to all major attractions BUT be warned and make sure you book a room at the rear of the hotel. We went with two other couples and were all allocated rooms on the 1st Floor at the front. The noise from traffic below was incredible and went on till 1.00am and beyond. I have never slept adjacent to a motorway before but this must be as close as it gets. We survived the first night with little sleep and asked for a room change to the rear the following day. The staff were very good and re-located us to the 4th Floor at the rear. What a difference, peace and quiet for the other two nights. Our friends persevered for the other two nights, bless them! Breakfast is quite bland. Roof terrace is brilliant with tremendous views and a sunbathe if you have time. I can only think this hotel qualifies for its' fourth star because of its' location. Rooms are a little tired and in need of some TLC. I certainly won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “"4" star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kakaZagreb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pace Helvezia hotel for 4 nights nad it was a disaster. We arrived at 9:30 PM, so our agent arranged us (our group) a dinner. It was catastrophic. First, they gave us ladagne that looked awful, but tasted okay. When the waiter took our plates he took our knife also, (that we used to eat) but he put it beside our second plate, so we can use it AGAIN (we were shocked). Then he gave everyone two slices of meat (bad quality) and after 10 minutes (we thought that our dinner ended) he started serving us potatos, the same thing happened with salad. The next morning, we ordered cappuccino for breakfast, and the waitress was nervous, so she didn't want to give us our drink!!!! The mini bar is also closed, and you can't open it, the beds are ready for garbage ( I think they have better beds in jails) and the elevator doesn't work. Without mentioning the loud street this is a maximun of 2 star hotel. We joked that this hotel has got 2 stars for inside and 2 stars for outside, and when you put it together is a 4 star hotel :). P.S. I advise you to look for an another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Rome's birthday weekend in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anjafial
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a marvellous weekend in Rome on its birthday weekend (21st April). It was 24/25 degrees and was simply stunning. We booked the Pace Helvezia through a hotel search engine and read the (rather mixed) reviews of the hotel through Trip Advisor. We were a mixed party of 14 and had booked 7 rooms at 230 Euros per night. We found the hotel, and the service from the reception staff to be excellent, and our rooms were provided promptly on arrival although we had arrived to check in at 11.30am (the hotel check in is 1.00pm). We were actually provided with an upgraded room (102) which surely must be one of the best in the hotel. It has a fantastic balcony with stunning views across to Palazzo Vict Eman. and Piazza Venezia and was immediately adjacent to the access to the roof top terrace. The terrace as other reviewers have said, is just incredible and with views in all directions has to be one of the best hotel locations in Rome. Although there is no bar on the roof terrace the hotel are quite happy for you to take your own drinks up there (or empty your mini bar from your room!) and it really is a must do after a day of sightseeing. All our party were happy with the hotel although the rooms on the lower floors were noisy. We had asked for, and were provided with, rooms on the back of the hotel, as we had read other reviews suggesting this. There is clearly a problem with the plumbing as the showers do tend to run hot and cold intermittently, and if staying for several days this could become very annoying. Finally on a not so positive note, the breakfast was very poor. When you are paying a high room rate is it too much too ask for a generous choice of breakfast ? The stated times for breakfast are 7.30 to 10.30am but at 9.30am we offered an extremely limted choice of ham, cheese and yoghurts. All pastries, croissants etc had gone and were not replenished. However this did not detract from our overall opinion of the hotel which was very positive. We will return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but NOISY”
Reviews.Author: dickersn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pace Helvezia for 4 nights including New Years Eve and New Years Day 2007. I had read the reviews before my stay so I knew what to expect. I agree with most of them. You couldn't ask for a more central location. The rooftop garden was an excellent place to sit and watch New Year's fireworks in every direction. From the rooftop you can see all the major monuments of Rome. Now for the bad part ... this was the loudest room I've ever tried to sleep in. My room was on the front of the hotel overlooking the street. The street below was unbelievably loud. Even with the window closed it was loud but when it was open it was unbearable. The room was very hot so the window had to be opened at least part of the time. So I had to "pick my poison" either the heat or the noise. Everything else was okay. The staff was pleasant, the breakfast was good, my bathroom was small but beautifully decorated and shiny clean. One of the two tiny elevators was out of service most of the time so I became aquainted with the 6 flights of stairs. Would I stay there again? Maybe ... but only because of the location. I would make sure I had a room on the back side of the hotel away from the front traffic.

Reviews.Title: “try somewhere else...i agree”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouse75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the last 4 days of our honeymoon. First the good. Good location...minutes walk to the Trevi fountain and Colosseum. The room was a triple so very spacious and clean. The staff were very nice and accomodating. They arranged for a taxi to the airport for 50 Euros. The internet is available for a small fee. The terrace is a nice feature but could do without. Now the bad stuff. The hotel is located on a very busy street so very noisy and I am a deep sleeper. The shower leaked all over the floor and the water did go very hot then very cold as I read in another review. Not a big deal but this should not happen. There are no safes in the room. The breakfast was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “TSE - Try Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: lucykitkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in October. Best feature is the roof top terrace but you need to take your own drinks up there as there is no bar service. Also location is superb. Rooms are tired and if you like a hot shower don't stay here. Water ran hot for 30 secs and then cold for 30 secs.I used the shower extension and ran the cold on my aching feet and used the hose to shower myself. Not good when you are paying top rate. Aircon noisy. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob.X.B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pace Helvezia Hotel for 3 nights in September 2006. As the other posts mention, this hotel has a great location. It is central to all of the main tourist sites, about 10 mins walk to most of them; with Vatican city above 30mins. Our travel agent suggested this hotel as someone had recently been there and recommended (The usual story!) but we decided to give it a go. The agent also said that the bathrooms have recently been updated. Our room was on the second floor, with a VERY small balcony (1 person) and the noise from the road was very loud, however I must say that it never kept us awake during the night. The bathroom was in good condition, cleaned every day with fresh towels. The bed wasn't so good, an old steel frame with a uncomfortable mattress. But the room was clean and tidy. The bar is a joke. In reality, there is no bar! It was never manned and when we checked they said it closed at 9:30pm anyway. Go to the shops and grab yourself a bottle of wine and sit at the roof top terrace. This is very good and has a nice atmosphere at night. Overall, not bad, but not great either. Great location, but no more than a bed a breakfast place. But I don't think you will find many other hotels in Rome for less cost that are in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “The location and roof-top terrace make this a great choice.”
Reviews.Author: VickiRuth
Reviews.Content: You can walk everywhere you want to go from this hotel. Though our first room was not great, we immediately went to the front desk and asked to be changed; Manolo was very helpful. Our second room was roomier and the bathroom was nice, but it didn't have an AC control so back down we went and he gave us the master control. After that we had no problems. Don't count on the bar being open. The breakfast each morning is very good and you MUST take a bottle of wine (chilled in your room fridge) up to the roof-top terrace each evening for a fantastic night view of Rome. I will definitely stay here the next time I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pace Helvezia”
Reviews.Author: Glo'ke
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a 4 day trip to Rome. We stayed in this hotel because it was recommended from our travel agency. I must say it was worth it. We did ask for a room on the back end of the hotel because we were said it was a busy street in front of the hotel. We got our room in the back, it was nice, big for city standards with a beautifull bathroom which only had one little negative point. The shower used to give you cold water now and then but that didn't bother s that much. The room was cleaned every day and the balcony gave you a great view on the Piazza Venezia. Breakfast was also good for city standards, no warm breakfast but pleanty of choices : cheese, yoghurt, cereals, fruit and lots of bagels. Don't forget to check out the roof terrace where you have an incredible view over Rome!! Good hotel in walking distance from the main sightseeing areas. You don't need a taxi to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon - what a disaster. It was suppose to be a 4 start hotel when we booked it - it had better have lost some stars since. Location is superb but don't be tempted booking here for that reason. The shower had no showerhead on it, the air conditioner didn't work but leaked water everywhere - the whole carpet was soaked underneath it, the toilet seat was broken and they never sorted any of it out. The bar was suppose to be a 24 hour service - we could not get one drink from there - it was never open even though the reception staff proceeded to help themselves to a drink from behind there while we were sitting in the bar waiting. They said it was closed now. We ended up having an argument with a couple of the staff - one of whom agreed it was a shambles and he would get us moved, which we did in the end.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me my husband and our 2yr old stayed here over xmas. the hotel was nice enough but definitely not a four star hotel. the best feature of this hotel is the location which is very central, the service in the hotel is terrible. they have a small bar (a china cabinet in the middle of a room) which even if you do get into it because it is very rarely opened be prepared to have to search the hotel for a barman when you want a drink. the staff arent very helpful after missing our breakfast because we were told that it was served until 10.30am my husband asked at reception if he could have a cup of coffee. we were told that there was no one about to make coffee but when he found someone he would send it up to the room, 3 hours later we got our coffee which was cold and undrinkable and on checking out we were charged 16 euros for it and the room service which we hadnt asked for in the first place. would never stay there again was expecting a treat over xmas by staying in a four star hotel we should have booked a cheap b&b it would have been up to the same standard and easier on the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Next trip, I'll stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: jjfrenz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pace Helvezia for four nights the first week in October 2005. The hotel feels very Italian but it's a bit dated and in need of some painting and cleaning. I was unhappy with the tiny bathroom in our room. The shower was small and had mildew between the tiles, and there was a "sewer smell" from the toilet that was overpowering. Maybe there is a big difference room to room because my friend said that her bathroom was very large and clean. The rest of the room seemed clean (and I'm picky) but the painted furniture and woodwork were quite chipped and in need of updating. The pillows were very flat. At least there were extra pillows in the closet. The hotel is located on a very busy street. Not only is the noise awful, but I didn't enjoy walking on the street outside the hotel because of all of the traffic. I longed for one of the many hotels I saw on quiet little streets! At the end of my stay, I saw a sign at the front desk that said all new check-ins for the day were being moved to another hotel because the Pace Helvezia had to "close a floor of the hotel due to problems with the water system." Since I was checking out, I didn't ask for details. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included and was good. Overall, the Pace Helvezia was okay, but it's pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not much has changed in two years”
Reviews.Author: Peters365
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two years ago and the air didn't work then either. However, the staff did move me to another room when I informed them. Turned out to be a better, much larger room at that. The view from the rooftop garden was great and although there was no bar, I loved to take a drink and my tour guide up there to map out the next days adventures. Breakfast was good and early so you can get a jump on the crowds with food in your stomach. All those scooters make a lot of noise. It was so noisy that after a week my nerves were wrecked, so I traveled to the Isle of Capri for a couple of days. I felt safe at night and able to visit the monuments more than once because they were so close. There were no ammenities and next year I plan on staying somewhere else. If you wanna really see Rome at your leisure, it wasn't so bad.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Pace Helvezia”
Reviews.Author: BioLum
Reviews.Content: Location: Could hardly be better! Walking distanse to most of city center. Close to public transport, but there is a busy street in front, ask for rooms at the other side. Nice exterior and interior. Front desk/staff: Very helpfull and kind. Internet connection. Sitting area. Rooms: Very good, but not to big, excelent bathrooms. Good aircondition, minibar and TV (CNN and BBC) The beds are King Size and the furniture look new and nice. Excellent cleaning every day, good towels. Elevators to all floors. Breakfast: Very good. And nice staff serving. Extras: The roof balcoony!!!!!!! The most romantic place in the world. You se all of Rome, the Colloseum, St Perters Church, Vit. Em. II monument and many more beautiful buildings. The Moon and the Stars and teardrops in the eays of of your wife too be after you proposed.......she said YES!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed there in july 2005. i found the hotel was very central. the trevi fountain is 5 mins away, and the colosseum about 10/15 mins. we walked everywhere even though it was over 30degrees. The hotel was very nice and the staff were friendly. The rooms were average size and clean. but the showers were dodgy! i would definatly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pace Helvetzia -Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: suepac
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the 4 stars and nice pictures on their website. We traveled with a group of family members. Some of the rooms had non-functioning air conditioning, dripping a/c units that soaked the rug or no remote control to control the a/c that was working. The worst part is the staff could not have cared less. The power went out several times leaving the hallways completely dark. They ran out of tissues! Someof the TVs worked nd some didn't. The only good things here are the breakfast and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified B & B”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I Just got back from 4 days at this hotel and I have to say I was glad to leave! The temperature in Rome was blistering hot and we had a mini bar (well stocked and reasonable) that kept everything VERY WARM!!! we asked 5 times for it to be changed, my husband got quite cross in the end.. he likes a cold beer and I like a cold pepsi after a busy day walking around Rome. The air conditioning was on full blast but not working at any kind of cool temperature and we struggled with the heat in our room day and night.It was very innefective and needs replacing The breakfast buffet was well stocked but the waitresses were very stressed and got edgy if you dare ask for a cuppa! the very same waitresses were then later cleaning rooms and tutting if you dare be around at that time... The roof terrace is a joke a few plastic chairs and a swing shoved on the top floor of the hotel, great view though. This hotel is a glorified Bed and breakfast with no service, no bar (never saw it open) no facilities, no charm and right on the very busy noisy main road. The positive points were it was clean and very central to every major monument etc.. we walked everywhere and everything was a reasonable stomping distance. I would not stay here again and think this hotel should be downgraded to a 3 star at best, we have stayed in many hotels allover the place and this was definately a dissapointment for us

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Gibso
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day trip to Rome in which i stayed at the Pace Helvezia.Upon our arrival we were greeted by friendly staff and check in was straight forward.First impressions were good ,the foyer area was nicely decorated and clean.The room itself was a nice size big enough to have a cot next to our bed and clean and bright. The only bad point about the room was the air conditioning was'nt up to scratch which gave us no relief from the heat. The breakfast was nice enough with a selection of fruit,cereal and pastries and quick service from the waitresses with tea or coffee. Now enough about the hotel itself the big draw here is the location all the major sites of rome are within walking distance the colosseum is 10 mins away and the trevi fountain 15mins away in the other direction,but if that sounds like hard work an open top bus stops near by which passes all the major sites. To sum this hotel up i'd say it is'nt a 4 star hotel but if you want a clean friendly place to stay in a great location and at a good price try the Pace Helvezia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: SMKacz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two-week trip to Italy, and the Pace was one of the nicer hotels that we stayed at. Now grant you, my scale is based on Italian hotels, not comparing to anything in the US, as the caliber of hotels are definitely different. It was in a great location! Within walking distance of virtually everything with the exception of maybe the Vatican. The hotel itself is pretty nice. The rooms are a decent size and the bathrooms are some of the biggest we encountered in Italy. It is pretty noisy in Rome with the windows open, but with the windows shut, we couldn't hear a peep. Would definitely consider staying there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience at the Pace Helvezia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the Pace Helvezia Hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel had a beautiful reception area and we thought we were in for a treat. Well...we were very wrong. Our room was on the top floor....#112. The only good thing was that we were close to the door to the rooftop terrace (which was quite nice). Our room was absolutely tiny...there was hardly room enough for us to open our suitcases. After sitting in the room for a few minutes, we noticed a loud noice that seemed to turn on and off every few minutes. Apparently, our room was next door to the boiler/pump room. So....every few minutes, you would hear this very loud, whirring type of noise. We were so tired after our awful driving experience through Rome, that we decided to just deal with the room. Come the next morning, the pump noise seemed to just stay on continuously....turns out it must have been the water pump and was now running non-stop due to everyone taking showers. Come to find out....getting up at 8am was apparently too late as there was now no more water. The water would hardly spray out of the sink faucet and then just didn't work at all. When we did get water, it was full of sediment. Breakfast was nothing to write home about. Though we liked the rooftop patio, having our room next to the door up to it was not pleasant. People were constantly stomping by our door and the terrace door was constantly being slammed. We had a horrible experience at Pace Helvezia and would never stay there again. The only good thing about it was that the hotel was close to several of the sights and had a nice rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bernice7
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a short break in this wonderful city, so much to see, so a return visit is definitely on the cards. Having booked this hotel before I read the reviews, I was a little worried about what I might find, fortunately all of my fears were washed away as soon as we arrived. Four of us stayed at the hotel, both double rooms were absolutely fine, not noisy, we were on the fourth floor yes maybe they need a lick of paint here and there. The bathrooms were more than adequate, very clean and lots of hot water and lovely white towels. Breakfast every day was good and plentiful. The rooftop terrace was an absolute bonus, spent some time up there every night before we went out for dinner with a glass of wine. Very helpful staff. My only dissapointment was that the bar closed at 9.30, having returned to the hotel from having dinner, sometimes it's nice to have a nightcap before retiring, but none the less, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do it!”
Reviews.Author: ausipom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the location of this hotel and the staff were really helpful too. It's an Italian 4 star hotel which means about 2 star by other country standards but who cares.....you're in ROME! It was very clean with brilliant showers (no bath which I could have used after walking everywhere!) and a lovely roof top to watch the sun set. You must try a really cool restaurant / bar not far from the hotel called The Supper Club - it's ultra cool and different to normal dining! Have fun and remember....when in Rome..........!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: SueM_9
Reviews.Content: Whether you should chose this hotel depends on what you want. If it's 5* standards then don't. Our room 86 (5th floor) was shabby: Dated decor, peeling wallpaper, polystyrene tiled ceiling and faint smell of cigarette smoke in the night but it was clean and we had a small balcony overlooking a side street with pleasant views. Showers had to be quick, whilst trying to unblock the waste using big toe to lift the grid cover, because the shower tray would fill up and threaten to flood the bathroom floor. Breakfast very continental. No toast. Just pastries, sugary cereal, bread, meats and cheeses. Roof terrace has fab views and pleasant seating but can't imagine spending much time on it when there is so much to see in Rome. Wouldn't like to rely on the air conditioning in high temperatures. Having said all this we took quite a liking both to our room and the hotel. The high rating is because the position is superb. Right slap bang in the middle of all the main tourist sights. No need to use public transport. Everywhere, including the Vatican (30 mins), is within walking distance. It is almost on Piazza Venezia. 5 min walk to Trevi fountain. 15 mins to Spanish Steps. We didn't even bother to get the bus (64) back to the train station. It is an easy 35 min walk. If I return to Rome would I stay at this hotel again? Definately.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: UkTraveller
Reviews.Content: was a bit dubious about staying here after reading some of the previous reviews. But as with every hotel you have the opportunity to check the hotel features and pictures on the Internet. So with this in mind, this is my review.
