The photos did not hide anything, it was a lovely hotel and yes I wouldnt rate it as a 4 star more a 2 - 3 star, but it was clean the room was small but I would say it was Cozy.... Just like a bedroom and hence all we wanted to do was sleep there not live in it. We stayed in Room 96 on the 5th floor, we had a balcony with a fantastic view, and yes the location was fantastic too, Last year I stayed near the Vatican but this has to be the best location, for getting to everything, a 5 minute stroll to the Trevi Fountain. I am giving this a great rating based on location and the lovely staff who work there. Who needs a huge room.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm second time in Rome, and I was really happy with my choise of hotel this time. Me and my wife, stayed there for 4 days in September 2004. It's the best location in Rome. Views from upper floors and from the roof terrasa are stunning. Just buy a bottle of wine and spend night on the roof. You can see Colosseum, Vatican and all the major attractions (roofs of course). All attractions are really walking distance from the hotel. So it was quite convenient to go in and out many times a day. For people who expect luxury from 4* in Rome - don't go there. Our room was quite small and furniture was quite basic. If that bothers you choose something else. *s in Rome are assigned first and most by location rather than luxury. And Pace Helvezia delivers perfect location, perfect views, good servise and adequate rooms. That's why I gave it top rating here. I prefer to see Rome from my window, rather than expensive furniture, and I could see half of the Rome from my windows on 4th floor. Room 94, if I remember well. Wiews from 1-3rd floor will be different, so during reservation ask for 4th or 5th floor overlooking Piazza Venezia. Stuff was very polite and helpful, and rooms vere clean. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Prices for a Two star Hotel! If you prefer 4 Star, Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DaneaB
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed with my stay here, especially having paid alot of money for three nights and expecting a four star hotel! This hotel should be rated Two Star, at best. I stayed in Room #9. The decor is in serious need of updating and renovation. Our double bed was rock solid and I could feel the springs beneath me. We were so uncomfortable. The bathroom was dirty and there was mildew in the shower and all around the sink. The faucets were crusty with a film of unknown origin ( a combination of age and dirt I suppose). The breakfast service was less than desirable and the coffee was terrible in comparsion to the beautifully steamed and freshly pressed coffee I had in our hotels in both Venice and Florence. The lighting was so dim, it made the room even gloomier. We just returned from our trip, having stayed here July 31st through August 3rd ( some of the hottest days in Rome). With that said, I have to say that the air conditioning was so useless that I cooled myself off better by standing still and sweating. I stood on a chair twice to make sure it was even working, it was that terrible! To top it off, in the unbearable heat they chose not to air condition the common areas of the hotel. We walked off the street sweating and would sweat some more just getting to our room. That was ridiculous. I chose the hotel because of its fabulous location (minutes walk to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Venezia and the Tragar Market) and 4 star rating. I paid a great deal of money for my brief stay and was so very dissappointed that I had spent so much for a low quality hotel. Do not stay here unless they close down and do a great deal of upgrading and refurbishing! You could better spend your money anywhere else. I would not reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location, staff really friendly and helpful. Close to the Trevi Fountain and many more of the attractions. Rooms are on the small side but this seems to be the norm in Rome, I am Catholic but have to say the religious pictures on the wall are really over the top. Very clean, shame the bar never seemed to be open. Plenty of choice at breakfast. Lovely rooftop terrace with spectacular views.

Reviews.Title: “A commercial opportunity wasted”
Reviews.Author: psycho
Reviews.Content: The Pace Helvezia is superbly located, being just round the corner from Trajan's Market and the Forum. It is a shame that the Leonardi Group does not take advantage of this to develop the hotel's full potential. The hotel was certainly 4-star - at least back in 1968. It fails, however to match any 4-star criteria by modern standards. The hotel is run on a shoe-string budget, to the extent that the friendly staff were put in the embarrassing position of explaining that there were no personnel available to serve drinks / provide much-needed refreshments outside breakfast hours. They dealt promptly with our leaking sink however and conjured up an extra chair from the "unused" bar to provide some seating in our room, to make up for the barrack-room beds and cramped accommodation. The breakfast fare was of very limited choice and monotonous. The view from the roof terrace was spectacular, although a total absence of any shelter (parasols / sunshades) restricted daytime viewing to 20 minutes at most to avoid the risk of excessive exposure to the sun. At night no illumination was provided and we fear that it is only a matter of time before an accident occurs. The staff were as conscientious and professional as their meagre resources allowed. Running a "pension" with a 4-star label was clearly a matter of embarrassment for them. One final point: not all guests are of Roman Catholic persuasion. Our room was adorned by a depiction of the Virgin Mary along with a gruesome picture of a heart surrounded by thorns which we found aesthetically grotesque. Some non-Catholics would find this grossly offensive. The Leonardi Group should clarify its objectives: either turn this hotel into a truly world-class operation worthy of its location or be honest and demote it by at least two stars to reflect its current reality.

Reviews.Title: “What a view from the rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are the rooftop terrace and the location. It's just two blocks from the Trevi Fountain and just around the block from the Piazza Venezia. T he Collesseum and Forum are within walking distance. T he rooms are large by European standards, but the beds were awful- either sunken or rock hard. Breakfast was very good and the management was helpful. Beware, there is a 3 Euro per day charge for a safe deposit box and a charge for internet use

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay - so after a thorough research into all the Rome hotels - I came up with the Pace. Just got back from 2 weeks there and I've got to tell you that we really enjoyed our stay. First thing I have to say is that the beds are terrible. But that, I believe, is apropos of many places in Rome. So - what I did was place a blanket under my sheet and after that it was just fine. Pace is definitely not a cozy rustic place with tons of charm, but I will tell you what it does have - great views, great location, and great staff. Some people have said that the staff are rude. I did find them to be "to the point" - but great to talk to if you take the time. We feel a loyalty to the Pace after this visit. We stayed in room 88 for the first 8 nights - with a balcony - but room 103 beat that one! The balcony is on the corner facing Vittorio Emmanuele and it is just amazing. So - if you need any more information about this place - feel free to email me. This website was terrific when I was making up my mind. The reviews helped and even though the Pace wasn't rated that high - I just had a feeling. And we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location but no soul”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights over a long weekend in January 2004. You can walk to any of the major sights from here, but the hotel room smelt smoky (even though it was a non-smoking room), the breakfast was lack-lustre and the public rooms downstairs largely empty. However, the reception staff were extremely helpful and polite.
